short: Whether to always show mode status
description: Controls whether the current mode name is always displayed in the status line. When enabled, the mode status (e.g., 'Normal', 'Insert', 'Visual') is always shown at the bottom of the page. When disabled, the mode status is only shown when explicitly set via a custom statusLine property. This is useful for users who want constant visual feedback about the current mode they're in, or for those who prefer a minimal UI.
valueDescription: Boolean flag to enable/disable mode status display

example.description: Enable mode status display to always show current mode

notes: This is a boolean setting that controls UI feedback about the current mode. When enabled, the mode name (Normal, Insert, Visual, etc.) is always displayed in the status line at the bottom of the page. When disabled, the status line only shows content if a custom statusLine property is explicitly set for a mode. The setting is dynamically toggled in response to certain user actions, particularly when editableBodyCare is enabled and the user interacts with editable elements. Note: In Firefox, enabling this setting may cause uiHost to be injected earlier than desired, potentially affecting compatibility with site scripts.
